job_description:
Adform focuses on an exploration of a vast amount of online advertising data, development of predictive and segmentation models to optimize campaign strategy towards the most meaningful inventory, audience and ad, fraud detection, and many others. You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. If you are hands-on passionate, crazy about a development of advanced algorithms, machine learning, statistics, Hadoop, Python and SQL, have an ownership mindset, love to work in teams with smart, informal and open people, we’d love to get to know you! 

Our focus is Big Data, High Load and challenging experiences with understanding and taking advantage from data in Ad-Tech industry.
 


We hope you are ready to change the game! Be ready to:

Apply advanced machine learning/statistical algorithms scalable to huge data sets to: 
Determine the most meaningful ad, served to the right user at the optimal time, and the best price 
Identify behaviours, interests and segments of web users across billions of transactions to find the most optimal audience for a given advertising activity 
Eliminate suspicious / non-human traffic 
Maintenance our products, support customers in analysing the reasons behind the decisions made by our algorithms and look for new improvements in the process of striving for their excellence 
Work closely with other Data Scientists, development, and product teams to implement algorithms into production-level software. Mentor less experienced colleagues. 
Contribute to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions 
Be an active technical challenger in the team for the purpose of mutual improvement and broadening of team and company horizons 
Design solutions and lead cross-functional technical projects from ideation to deployment 


Attitude First. Everything else will follow. We can grow together faster if you have:

Minimum 1 year work experience in a similar senior position. Minimum 6 years experience in Data Science in total. 
Masters or PhD in a quantitative field such as Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics or related. 
Excellent mathematical and statistical skills (statistical inference), experience in working with large datasets. Knowledge of data pipelines, ETL processes. 
Very good knowledge of multiply supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques with math background and hands-on experience 
Great problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Ability to structure a large business problem into tractable and reasonable components, design and deploy scalable machine learning solutions 
Proficiency in Python, SQL 
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop)
Adform‘s guiding principles ingrained in your profile: Focus on Client Value, Behave with Decency, Take Ownership, Care, Collaborateas a TeamPlayer, Remain Ambitious, and StandTall inall interactions 


Stand out by having:

Knowledge of Ad Tech industry solutions 
Knowledge of web technologies 


Our promise to you:

You will be a vital part of the data scientist efforts, working in a cross-functional international Agile team, with other data scientists, engineers, product managers, and leaders located in multiple locations around the world. 
A dynamic, inspiring, and international environment filled with ambitious and caring colleagues
Premium health insurance with ₹10,00,000 coverage for you and your family
24 paid vacation days to enjoy life outside of work
Paid maternity (6 months) and paternity (2 weeks)
Annual learning budget to help you grow your skills and support continuous learning
Rewarding referral program for helping us grow
Global perks such as birthday gifts, work anniversaries, and company events to connect with colleagues and have fun
And much more – join us to explore the full experience


Diversity s Inclusion @Adform:

Adform is an equal opportunity employer with a global perspective. We remain committed to creating an environment that not only respects different backgrounds but celebrates them too. We believe that diversity in all its forms enhances our teams’ creativity, innovation, and effectiveness, and therefore we value different backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
We are committed to creating a work environment where Adform employees feel valued for who they are and what they can contribute, free from any type of discrimination.

profile_data.headline: Jr. Machine Learning Engineer
profile_data.about:
Welcome to my world of AI-driven innovation and creativity!

As a Computer Science and Engineering graduate with a passion for Artificial Intelligence since 2017, I bring a fresh perspective to the dynamic world of technology. My journey began with a fascination for AI's potential to transform the way we interact with machines, and it quickly led me to specialize in Natural Language Processing and Generative AI.

Being a firm believer that communication is the key to success, I pride myself on my exceptional English communication skills, enabling me to bridge the gap between complex AI concepts and everyday conversations. I find joy in breaking down intricate technical jargon into accessible knowledge for everyone.

The ever-evolving landscape of artificial intelligence captivates me, and I am determined to be an active participant in its unfolding story. Staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI is not just a habit; it's a passion that drives me to explore, experiment, and share my insights with the world.

Driven by a relentless pursuit of excellence, I approach every project with a result-oriented mindset. The thirst for knowledge and a hunger to learn new things quickly propels me forward, fueling my desire to make a meaningful impact in the AI domain.

When it comes to turning ideas into reality, I wield the power of Python programming and leverage data science libraries to create AI solutions that go beyond the ordinary. My technical proficiency and problem-solving skills empower me to take on challenges with confidence and innovation.

With boundless curiosity and a commitment to excellence, I am eager to forge ahead in the realm of Artificial Intelligence, making significant contributions that shape the future. Join me on this exciting journey as we push the boundaries of what AI can achieve and unlock the full potential of this remarkable technology together.

Let's embark on a transformative AI adventure – one where creativity, dedication, and limitless possibilities converge. Together, we will shape the future of AI and create a world where intelligent machines revolutionize our lives for the better.

description.text:
Immersed in cutting-edge technologies, I gained substantial knowledge and practical experience in generative AI, system design, and integration of complex APIs. Enhanced my technical prowess using Docker and AWS to develop scalable solutions in a dynamic start-up environment.

Spearheaded the development of an innovative application designed to optimize resumes for ATS compatibility. This tool automatically analyzes resumes, identifies deficiencies, queries users to fill gaps, and reformats the information into an enhanced, ATS-friendly format, significantly boosting job seekers' chances of landing interviews.

Created a smart, adaptive question-answering system tailored for major standardized tests including IELTS, TOEFL, GMAT, and GRE. The system evaluates user responses, pinpoints errors, and generates personalized reports offering detailed insights and strategies for improving both topic-specific skills and overall exam performance.

• Engaged in an intensive training program focusing on Java and SQL, gaining foundational knowledge and expertise in both areas.
• Successfully completed monthly milestone tests with 82 %, demonstrating consistent growth and understanding of key concepts.
• Collaborated with a diverse team of interns, sharing insights and learning from collective experiences
• Demonstrated commitment and adaptability by quickly adjusting to the dynamic learning environment and meeting all set milestones.
Abdul R  IGNITE Training Completion Certificate.pdf

messages.ai_response: Hey there!  Since you didn't ask a specific question, I'm ready to help optimize your LinkedIn profile however you need. To give you the best advice, tell me what you'd like to improve – are you looking for more connections, job opportunities, or something else?  Knowing your goal will help me tailor my suggestions.

messages.user_query: Improve my profile so I can apply for Data Scientist role
messages.ai_response:
To make your LinkedIn profile shine for Data Scientist roles, let's focus on several key areas.  First, your headline needs a boost.  Instead of "Jr. Machine Learning Engineer," try something like "Data Scientist | Machine Learning Engineer | NLP Expertise | Generative AI" – this is more impactful and keyword-rich.

Next, we need to quantify your achievements.  For each experience entry, focus on the *impact* of your work.  For example, instead of simply stating you created an ATS-optimized resume tool, quantify the improvement: "Developed an ATS-optimized resume tool that increased candidate interview rates by X%."  This applies to all your roles.

Your skills section needs a revamp.  Prioritize skills like "Data Analysis," "Data Modeling," and "Data Manipulation" at the top.  Add crucial skills like "SQL," "Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn)," "Statistical Modeling," "Machine Learning Algorithms," and definitely "Spark" – this is directly relevant to many Data Scientist roles.  Make sure to include skills from your projects, too.

Your "About" section is a bit long.  Condense it to 2-3 paragraphs highlighting your key skills and accomplishments, emphasizing your problem-solving abilities and impactful results.  Use keywords like "data analysis," "machine learning," "model building," and "predictive analytics."

Critically, your profile needs to prominently feature keywords like "Big Data," "Machine Learning," "Statistical Algorithms," "Python," "SQL," "Hadoop," "Scalable Solutions," and "Data Pipelines."  Also, include "Predictive Modeling," "Segmentation Models," and "Fraud Detection" where relevant.  Remember, you only have one year of experience currently, significantly less than the six years often required.  To compensate, strongly emphasize your accomplishments and projects, quantifying your impact with numbers to showcase your abilities.  This is crucial for bridging the experience gap.

Finally, consider strengthening your profile in areas like advanced machine learning techniques (deep learning, reinforcement learning, time series analysis),  statistical inference, and ETL/pipeline experience (using tools like Apache Airflow).  Gaining experience with big data technologies like Spark and Hadoop is also highly recommended.  Familiarizing yourself with the Ad Tech industry is another area for improvement, as this is relevant to many Data Scientist roles.  Consider online courses, personal projects (using datasets from Kaggle, for example), and relevant certifications to address these skill gaps.  Remember to tailor your resume and LinkedIn profile to highlight your accomplishments and quantify your impact whenever possible.

messages.user_query: I wanna becom a data scientist suggest me stuff based on my role
messages.ai_response:
To successfully transition into a data scientist role, let's focus on enhancing your LinkedIn profile and developing key skills.  Your current experience as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer provides a strong foundation, but some targeted improvements will significantly boost your candidacy.

First, update your LinkedIn headline to something concise like "Data Scientist | Machine Learning Engineer | Python | AWS," highlighting your target role and most relevant skills.  In your "About" section, quantify your achievements with specific numbers (e.g., "Improved model accuracy by 15%"). Focus on skills directly relevant to data science, like data manipulation and statistical modeling, and add a strong call to action, inviting recruiters to connect.

Within your LearnTube.ai experience section, continue to quantify your impact. Instead of general statements, use metrics like "Increased interview rates by X%" or "Improved average user scores by Y points."  This demonstrates your ability to measure and improve results, a critical skill for data scientists.

To strengthen your profile further, prioritize these keywords:  Big Data, Machine Learning, Statistical Algorithms, Python, SQL, and Hadoop.  Adding "Spark" and more prominently featuring your AWS and Docker experience, linking them to scalable solutions, will also significantly improve your profile's visibility.  The job description emphasizes 6 years of experience, so make sure your profile clearly communicates the extent and relevance of your experience.

Critically, you need to develop skills in big data technologies (Spark/Hadoop), ETL processes, and advanced statistical modeling and inference.  Consider structured online courses (Coursera, edX, Udacity) for Spark and Hadoop, and explore ETL tools like Apache Kafka or AWS Glue.  Focus on mastering statistical inference and techniques like regression and time series analysis.  Building projects using publicly available datasets or Kaggle competitions will solidify your understanding and provide demonstrable experience.  Familiarizing yourself with the AdTech landscape will give you a competitive edge.

By implementing these profile updates and focusing on these skill gaps, you'll significantly increase your chances of securing a data scientist role.  Remember to continuously update your LinkedIn profile to reflect your progress. Your existing focus on quantifiable results is excellent; maintain this approach as you acquire new skills.

messages.user_query: I wanna becom a data scientist suggest me stuff to learn based on my role
messages.ai_response:
## Skill Gap Analysis: Abdul Basith R - Data Scientist Transition

This analysis compares Abdul Basith R's current skills and experience (as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer) with the requirements of a Data Scientist role at Adform, focusing on the top 3-5 most critical skill gaps.

**1.  Years of Experience:**

* **Current State:** 1 year in a Junior Machine Learning Engineer role.
* **Target State:** Minimum 1 year in a similar senior position; Minimum 6 years of total Data Science experience.
* **Gap Identification:** Significant experience gap.  This is not something that can be directly "learned," but rather gained through practical application.
* **Priority Ranking:** Highest Priority – Critical Gap.  Addressing this will require a strategic career progression plan, potentially involving lateral moves to roles with increasing responsibility.
* **Learning Pathway:** Focus on taking on more senior responsibilities within current role or seeking a mid-level Data Scientist position at a smaller company.  Actively seek projects that showcase advanced data science skills and leadership.  Highlight accomplishments with quantifiable results in your updated LinkedIn profile.

**2.  Big Data Tool Proficiency (Spark/Hadoop):**

* **Current State:**  Limited experience mentioned in education, but not explicitly demonstrated in work experience.
* **Target State:**  Proficiency in big data tools like Spark and Hadoop is explicitly required.
* **Gap Identification:**  Missing or underdeveloped skill.
* **Priority Ranking:** High Priority – Critical Gap. Adform's focus on Big Data necessitates this skill.
* **Learning Pathway:**
    * **Online Courses:** DataCamp, Coursera, edX offer courses on Spark and Hadoop. Choose a course focusing on practical application and project work.
    * **Hands-on Projects:** Create personal projects using publicly available large datasets (e.g., Kaggle datasets) to build experience with Spark/Hadoop.  Document these projects on GitHub.
    * **Certifications:** Consider obtaining relevant certifications to demonstrate competency.

**3.  Advanced Statistical Modeling and Machine Learning Techniques:**

* **Current State:** Possesses foundational knowledge in machine learning, as evident from his profile and experience.
* **Target State:**  Requires very good knowledge of multiple supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques with a strong mathematical background and hands-on experience.  Specifically, the ability to apply these techniques to large datasets and solve complex business problems.
* **Gap Identification:** Needs deeper expertise in advanced techniques and their application to real-world problems at scale.
* **Priority Ranking:** High Priority – Critical Gap.  This is core to the Data Scientist role at Adform.
* **Learning Pathway:**
    * **Advanced Courses:** Explore specialized courses on topics like time series analysis, deep learning, reinforcement learning, etc.  Focus on courses with strong theoretical foundations and practical applications.
    * **Research Papers:** Read research papers on cutting-edge techniques in relevant areas to deepen theoretical understanding.
    * **Case Studies:** Analyze real-world case studies of how advanced ML techniques are applied to solve business problems in the AdTech industry.

**4.  Data Pipelines and ETL Processes:**

* **Current State:**  Some experience implied but not explicitly detailed.
* **Target State:**  Explicit knowledge of data pipelines and ETL processes is required.
* **Gap Identification:**  Needs demonstrable experience and knowledge.
* **Priority Ranking:** Medium Priority – Critical Gap.  Essential for working with large datasets.
* **Learning Pathway:**
    * **Online Courses:** Look for courses specifically on data pipelines, ETL processes, and tools like Apache Airflow.
    * **Projects:**  Design and implement a small-scale data pipeline project using publicly available data.  This could involve data cleaning, transformation, and loading into a database or data warehouse.


**Competitive Advantages:**  Knowledge of the AdTech industry and web technologies would strongly differentiate Abdul Basith from other candidates.  He should actively seek opportunities to gain this knowledge through networking, online resources, and potentially short courses.

This analysis prioritizes immediate action on building experience and big data skills.  Further detailed plans for each learning pathway can be provided upon request.  The key is to demonstrate practical application and quantifiable results in each area.

messages.user_query: just give me the skills or topics that I need to do
messages.ai_response:
Based on your profile and the Adform Data Scientist job description, here are the top 3-5 skill gaps and actionable development recommendations, focusing on leveraging your existing Machine Learning Engineering experience:

**CRITICAL GAPS (High Priority):**

1. **Years of Experience:** The job posting explicitly requires a minimum of 1 year in a senior Data Scientist role and 6 years total experience in Data Science.  This is the most significant gap.  Focus on gaining relevant experience through projects, contributions to open-source projects, or seeking a more senior role within your current company.  Consider highlighting transferable skills from your current role to emphasize your readiness for more responsibility.  *Recommendation:* Actively seek projects that involve end-to-end data science workflows, from problem definition to deployment and monitoring, to build your portfolio and demonstrate senior-level capabilities.  Target projects with larger datasets to showcase your experience with big data.

2. **Big Data Tool Proficiency (Spark/Hadoop):** While you have experience with some data manipulation, the Adform role emphasizes proficiency with Spark and Hadoop for handling large datasets.  *Recommendation:*  Enroll in a focused online course (e.g., Coursera, DataCamp, Udacity) on Spark or Hadoop.  Supplement this with hands-on projects using publicly available large datasets (e.g., from Kaggle).  Start with smaller projects to build confidence and then gradually increase the complexity and dataset size.

3. **Advanced Statistical Modeling & Inference:**  The job description highlights the need for strong statistical skills and experience applying advanced statistical algorithms. While your background includes some statistical knowledge, strengthening this area is critical.  *Recommendation:* Focus on courses or books covering advanced statistical modeling techniques relevant to data science, such as time series analysis, causal inference, and Bayesian methods.  Practise these techniques on real-world datasets, documenting your approaches and results.


**COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES (Medium Priority):**

4. **Ad Tech Industry Knowledge:** Familiarity with the Ad Tech industry will significantly boost your candidacy.  *Recommendation:* Research leading Ad Tech companies and their technologies.  Read industry blogs and publications to understand current trends and challenges.  Networking with professionals in the Ad Tech space (LinkedIn, industry events) can provide valuable insights and potential contacts.


**FOUNDATIONAL SKILLS (Low Priority - likely already covered):**

* **Python & SQL:** Your profile indicates proficiency in these.  Continue to enhance your skills through practice and exploring advanced libraries as needed.


**DEVELOPMENT TIMELINE (Illustrative):**

* **Months 1-3:** Focus on Big Data tools (Spark/Hadoop) through online courses and hands-on projects.
* **Months 4-6:** Deepen your statistical modeling skills, focusing on advanced techniques.  Simultaneously, begin actively searching for projects demonstrating senior-level capabilities.
* **Months 7-12:** Continue building your portfolio, focusing on projects that directly address the needs of the Adform role (e.g., fraud detection, audience segmentation).  Research and network within the Ad Tech industry.

This plan prioritizes rapid skill acquisition in critical areas while building a strong portfolio to compensate for the experience gap. Remember, consistent effort and demonstrable results are key to a successful career transition.

messages.user_query: just list them please so I can find or do courses
messages.ai_response:
To transition into a Data Scientist role at Adform from your current position as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer, focus on these key skill areas:

**1.  Years of Experience:** This is a critical gap.  Gaining experience is crucial.  Actively seek opportunities within your current role to take on more responsibility and lead projects. Consider contributing to open-source projects or participating in Kaggle competitions to build your portfolio and demonstrate your skills.

**2. Advanced Statistical Modeling & Inference:**  Strengthen your understanding of statistical inference, hypothesis testing, and model evaluation metrics beyond what's used in your current ML role.  

   * **Learning Recommendation:** Online courses (Coursera, edX, DataCamp) on statistical modeling, Bayesian methods, time series analysis, and causal inference.

**3. Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark):**  Adform emphasizes big data experience.  Familiarize yourself with Hadoop's distributed file system (HDFS) and Spark's processing capabilities.

   * **Learning Recommendation:**  Online courses and tutorials focusing on Hadoop ecosystem components (HDFS, YARN, MapReduce) and Spark's RDDs and DataFrame APIs.  Hands-on projects using cloud-based big data platforms (AWS EMR, Azure HDInsight, Google Dataproc) are essential.


**4.  Data Pipelines and ETL Processes:** Gain practical experience designing and implementing data pipelines for data ingestion, transformation, and loading.

   * **Learning Recommendation:**  Explore tools like Apache Airflow, Prefect, or cloud-based ETL services (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory).  Focus on building end-to-end pipelines to handle large datasets.

**5.  Advanced Machine Learning Techniques (Supervised & Unsupervised):**  While you have ML experience, deepen your knowledge of advanced techniques relevant to AdTech (e.g., recommendation systems, anomaly detection, fraud detection).

   * **Learning Recommendation:**  Focus on specific algorithms like gradient boosting machines (XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost), deep learning architectures (for recommendation systems or image/text processing if relevant to AdTech), and clustering algorithms (k-means, DBSCAN, hierarchical clustering).


This list prioritizes immediate, high-impact skills.  Remember to tailor your learning path based on the specific requirements of Adform's data scientist roles and your progress.  Continuously update your LinkedIn profile to reflect your skill development.

It sounds like you're aiming for a significant career shift, from your current role as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer to becoming a CTO.  That's an ambitious goal, and it requires a different approach than the Data Scientist path we've been discussing.  While your data science skills will be valuable assets, the CTO role demands a broader range of experience and expertise.  To help you get started, we need to understand your current skillset in areas such as leadership, strategy, business acumen, and technology management.  Could you tell me more about your experience in these areas?  Once we have a clearer picture of your background and aspirations, I can provide more specific advice on how to tailor your LinkedIn profile, identify relevant learning opportunities, and chart a course towards your CTO goal.

messages.user_query: just based on my current profile tell me how to become a cto
messages.ai_response:
Based on your profile as a Junior Machine Learning Engineer and your aspiration to become a CTO, the transition requires a significant shift in skillset and experience.  Your current technical skills are a valuable foundation, but the CTO role demands extensive leadership, business acumen, and strategic thinking.

Here are the top 3-5 CRITICAL skill gaps to prioritize:

1. **Leadership & Management Experience:**  Your current role lacks the depth of leadership experience needed to manage large engineering teams and guide technological strategy.  This is a *must-have* for a CTO position.

    * **Learning Recommendation:** Seek opportunities to lead projects, mentor junior engineers, or take on team leadership responsibilities within your current organization.  Consider pursuing relevant certifications like Project Management Professional (PMP) or Agile certifications (e.g., Scrum Master).  Actively network with experienced CTOs and engineering managers to learn from their experiences.

2. **Business Acumen & Strategy:**  Understanding business models, financial statements, market analysis, and strategic planning are crucial for a CTO. Your background primarily focuses on technical aspects.

    * **Learning Recommendation:**  Take online courses on business strategy, financial modeling, and market analysis (e.g., Coursera, edX).  Read industry publications and case studies focusing on technology companies.  Consider an MBA or a specialized management program if you want a more formal approach.

3. **Software Engineering Management:** While you have experience with some aspects of software development, managing the entire software lifecycle, architecture, and engineering teams is a critical gap.

    * **Learning Recommendation:** Focus on learning software architecture principles, DevOps practices, and cloud technologies.  Explore online courses and certifications related to these areas.  Actively seek opportunities to work on projects that involve collaborating with engineering teams and understanding their challenges.

4. **Strategic Technology Vision:** A CTO needs to anticipate future technology trends and develop a long-term technology roadmap aligned with the company's overall business goals.

    * **Learning Recommendation:**  Follow industry leaders and thought leaders in technology.  Attend conferences and webinars to stay updated on emerging trends.  Engage in discussions and debates about future technology directions.


5. **Experience with Large-Scale Systems:** Your current experience is likely limited to smaller-scale projects.  CTOs need experience managing and scaling complex systems and infrastructure.

    * **Learning Recommendation:** Seek out projects that involve working with larger datasets and more complex systems.  Familiarize yourself with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their scalability features.  Consider contributing to open-source projects to gain hands-on experience.


These are high-priority areas.  Addressing these gaps will significantly improve your candidacy for a CTO role.  The timeline for achieving this will depend on your dedication and learning capacity, but expect this to be a multi-year journey.  Remember to focus on gaining practical experience alongside theoretical knowledge.
